summary.long: 1 Corinthians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, called to be an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and our brother Sosthenes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the church of God in Corinth, to those sanctified in Christ Jesus and called to be his holy people, together with all those everywhere who call on the name of our Lord Jesus Christ—their Lord and ours:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I always thank my God for you because of his grace given you in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in him you have been enriched in every way—with all kinds of speech and with all knowledge—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God thus confirming our testimony about Christ among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore you do not lack any spiritual gift as you eagerly wait for our Lord Jesus Christ to be revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will also keep you firm to the end, so that you will be blameless on the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God is faithful, who has called you into fellowship with his Son, Jesus Christ our Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I appeal to you, brothers and sisters, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that all of you agree with one another in what you say and that there be no divisions among you, but that you be perfectly united in mind and thought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My brothers and sisters, some from Chloe’s household have informed me that there are quarrels among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What I mean is this: One of you says, “I follow Paul”; another, “I follow Apollos”; another, “I follow Cephas”; still another, “I follow Christ.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is Christ divided? Was Paul crucified for you? Were you baptized in the name of Paul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thank God that I did not baptize any of you except Crispus and Gaius,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so no one can say that you were baptized in my name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Yes, I also baptized the household of Stephanas; beyond that, I don’t remember if I baptized anyone else.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Christ did not send me to baptize, but to preach the gospel—not with wisdom and eloquence, lest the cross of Christ be emptied of its power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the message of the cross is foolishness to those who are perishing, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Where is the wise person? Where is the teacher of the law? Where is the philosopher of this age? Has not God made foolish the wisdom of the world?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For since in the wisdom of God the world through its wisdom did not know him, God was pleased through the foolishness of what was preached to save those who believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jews demand signs and Greeks look for wisdom,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but we preach Christ crucified: a stumbling block to Jews and foolishness to Gentiles,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but to those whom God has called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God and the wisdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the foolishness of God is wiser than human wisdom, and the weakness of God is stronger than human strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers and sisters, think of what you were when you were called. Not many of you were wise by human standards; not many were influential; not many were of noble birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God chose the foolish things of the world to shame the wise; God chose the weak things of the world to shame the strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God chose the lowly things of this world and the despised things—and the things that are not—to nullify the things that are,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that no one may boast before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is because of him that you are in Christ Jesus, who has become for us wisdom from God—that is, our righteousness, holiness and redemption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, as it is written: “Let the one who boasts boast in the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so it was with me, brothers and sisters. When I came to you, I did not come with eloquence or human wisdom as I proclaimed to you the testimony about God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I resolved to know nothing while I was with you except Jesus Christ and him crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I came to you in weakness with great fear and trembling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My message and my preaching were not with wise and persuasive words, but with a demonstration of the Spirit’s power,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that your faith might not rest on human wisdom, but on God’s power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We do, however, speak a message of wisdom among the mature, but not the wisdom of this age or of the rulers of this age, who are coming to nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No, we declare God’s wisdom, a mystery that has been hidden and that God destined for our glory before time began.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None of the rulers of this age understood it, for if they had, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
However, as it is written:
“What no eye has seen,
    what no ear has heard,
and what no human mind has conceived”—
    the things God has prepared for those who love him—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
these are the things God has revealed to us by his Spirit.
The Spirit searches all things, even the deep things of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For who knows a person’s thoughts except their own spirit within them? In the same way no one knows the thoughts of God except the Spirit of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What we have received is not the spirit of the world, but the Spirit who is from God, so that we may understand what God has freely given us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what we speak, not in words taught us by human wisdom but in words taught by the Spirit, explaining spiritual realities with Spirit-taught words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person without the Spirit does not accept the things that come from the Spirit of God but considers them foolishness, and cannot understand them because they are discerned only through the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person with the Spirit makes judgments about all things, but such a person is not subject to merely human judgments,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for,
“Who has known the mind of the Lord
    so as to instruct him?”
But we have the mind of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers and sisters, I could not address you as people who live by the Spirit but as people who are still worldly—mere infants in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave you milk, not solid food, for you were not yet ready for it. Indeed, you are still not ready.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are still worldly. For since there is jealousy and quarreling among you, are you not worldly? Are you not acting like mere humans?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when one says, “I follow Paul,” and another, “I follow Apollos,” are you not mere human beings?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What, after all, is Apollos? And what is Paul? Only servants, through whom you came to believe—as the Lord has assigned to each his task.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I planted the seed, Apollos watered it, but God has been making it grow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So neither the one who plants nor the one who waters is anything, but only God, who makes things grow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who plants and the one who waters have one purpose, and they will each be rewarded according to their own labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are co-workers in God’s service; you are God’s field, God’s building.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By the grace God has given me, I laid a foundation as a wise builder, and someone else is building on it. But each one should build with care.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For no one can lay any foundation other than the one already laid, which is Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone builds on this foundation using gold, silver, costly stones, wood, hay or straw,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their work will be shown for what it is, because the Day will bring it to light. It will be revealed with fire, and the fire will test the quality of each person’s work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If what has been built survives, the builder will receive a reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it is burned up, the builder will suffer loss but yet will be saved—even though only as one escaping through the flames.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t you know that you yourselves are God’s temple and that God’s Spirit dwells in your midst?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone destroys God’s temple, God will destroy that person; for God’s temple is sacred, and you together are that temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not deceive yourselves. If any of you think you are wise by the standards of this age, you should become “fools” so that you may become wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness in God’s sight. As it is written: “He catches the wise in their craftiness”;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and again, “The Lord knows that the thoughts of the wise are futile.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, no more boasting about human leaders! All things are yours,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whether Paul or Apollos or Cephas or the world or life or death or the present or the future—all are yours,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you are of Christ, and Christ is of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This, then, is how you ought to regard us: as servants of Christ and as those entrusted with the mysteries God has revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it is required that those who have been given a trust must prove faithful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I care very little if I am judged by you or by any human court; indeed, I do not even judge myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My conscience is clear, but that does not make me innocent. It is the Lord who judges me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore judge nothing before the appointed time; wait until the Lord comes. He will bring to light what is hidden in darkness and will expose the motives of the heart. At that time each will receive their praise from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, brothers and sisters, I have applied these things to myself and Apollos for your benefit, so that you may learn from us the meaning of the saying, “Do not go beyond what is written.” Then you will not be puffed up in being a follower of one of us over against the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For who makes you different from anyone else? What do you have that you did not receive? And if you did receive it, why do you boast as though you did not?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Already you have all you want! Already you have become rich! You have begun to reign—and that without us! How I wish that you really had begun to reign so that we also might reign with you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it seems to me that God has put us apostles on display at the end of the procession, like those condemned to die in the arena. We have been made a spectacle to the whole universe, to angels as well as to human beings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are fools for Christ, but you are so wise in Christ! We are weak, but you are strong! You are honored, we are dishonored!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To this very hour we go hungry and thirsty, we are in rags, we are brutally treated, we are homeless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We work hard with our own hands. When we are cursed, we bless; when we are persecuted, we endure it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when we are slandered, we answer kindly. We have become the scum of the earth, the garbage of the world—right up to this moment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am writing this not to shame you but to warn you as my dear children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if you had ten thousand guardians in Christ, you do not have many fathers, for in Christ Jesus I became your father through the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I urge you to imitate me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason I have sent to you Timothy, my son whom I love, who is faithful in the Lord. He will remind you of my way of life in Christ Jesus, which agrees with what I teach everywhere in every church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of you have become arrogant, as if I were not coming to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will come to you very soon, if the Lord is willing, and then I will find out not only how these arrogant people are talking, but what power they have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the kingdom of God is not a matter of talk but of power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What do you prefer? Shall I come to you with a rod of discipline, or shall I come in love and with a gentle spirit?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is actually reported that there is sexual immorality among you, and of a kind that even pagans do not tolerate: A man is sleeping with his father’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you are proud! Shouldn’t you rather have gone into mourning and have put out of your fellowship the man who has been doing this?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For my part, even though I am not physically present, I am with you in spirit. As one who is present with you in this way, I have already passed judgment in the name of our Lord Jesus on the one who has been doing this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when you are assembled and I am with you in spirit, and the power of our Lord Jesus is present,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: hand this man over to Satan for the destruction of the flesh, so that his spirit may be saved on the day of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your boasting is not good. Don’t you know that a little yeast leavens the whole batch of dough?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get rid of the old yeast, so that you may be a new unleavened batch—as you really are. For Christ, our Passover lamb, has been sacrificed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore let us keep the Festival, not with the old bread leavened with malice and wickedness, but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I wrote to you in my letter not to associate with sexually immoral people—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not at all meaning the people of this world who are immoral, or the greedy and swindlers, or idolaters. In that case you would have to leave this world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now I am writing to you that you must not associate with anyone who claims to be a brother or sister but is sexually immoral or greedy, an idolater or slanderer, a drunkard or swindler. Do not even eat with such people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What business is it of mine to judge those outside the church? Are you not to judge those inside?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God will judge those outside. “Expel the wicked person from among you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any of you has a dispute with another, do you dare to take it before the ungodly for judgment instead of before the Lord’s people?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or do you not know that the Lord’s people will judge the world? And if you are to judge the world, are you not competent to judge trivial cases?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not know that we will judge angels? How much more the things of this life!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, if you have disputes about such matters, do you ask for a ruling from those whose way of life is scorned in the church?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say this to shame you. Is it possible that there is nobody among you wise enough to judge a dispute between believers?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But instead, one brother takes another to court—and this in front of unbelievers!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The very fact that you have lawsuits among you means you have been completely defeated already. Why not rather be wronged? Why not rather be cheated?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, you yourselves cheat and do wrong, and you do this to your brothers and sisters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or do you not know that wrongdoers will not inherit the kingdom of God? Do not be deceived: Neither the sexually immoral nor idolaters nor adulterers nor men who have sex with men
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor thieves nor the greedy nor drunkards nor slanderers nor swindlers will inherit the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And that is what some of you were. But you were washed, you were sanctified, you were justified in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ and by the Spirit of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have the right to do anything,” you say—but not everything is beneficial. “I have the right to do anything”—but I will not be mastered by anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You say, “Food for the stomach and the stomach for food, and God will destroy them both.” The body, however, is not meant for sexual immorality but for the Lord, and the Lord for the body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By his power God raised the Lord from the dead, and he will raise us also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not know that your bodies are members of Christ himself? Shall I then take the members of Christ and unite them with a prostitute? Never!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not know that he who unites himself with a prostitute is one with her in body? For it is said, “The two will become one flesh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whoever is united with the Lord is one with him in spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Flee from sexual immorality. All other sins a person commits are outside the body, but whoever sins sexually, sins against their own body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not know that your bodies are temples of the Holy Spirit, who is in you, whom you have received from God? You are not your own;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you were bought at a price. Therefore honor God with your bodies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now for the matters you wrote about: “It is good for a man not to have sexual relations with a woman.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But since sexual immorality is occurring, each man should have sexual relations with his own wife, and each woman with her own husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The husband should fulfill his marital duty to his wife, and likewise the wife to her husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wife does not have authority over her own body but yields it to her husband. In the same way, the husband does not have authority over his own body but yields it to his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not deprive each other except perhaps by mutual consent and for a time, so that you may devote yourselves to prayer. Then come together again so that Satan will not tempt you because of your lack of self-control.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say this as a concession, not as a command.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I wish that all of you were as I am. But each of you has your own gift from God; one has this gift, another has that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now to the unmarried and the widows I say: It is good for them to stay unmarried, as I do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they cannot control themselves, they should marry, for it is better to marry than to burn with passion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the married I give this command (not I, but the Lord): A wife must not separate from her husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if she does, she must remain unmarried or else be reconciled to her husband. And a husband must not divorce his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the rest I say this (I, not the Lord): If any brother has a wife who is not a believer and she is willing to live with him, he must not divorce her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a woman has a husband who is not a believer and he is willing to live with her, she must not divorce him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the unbelieving husband has been sanctified through his wife, and the unbelieving wife has been sanctified through her believing husband. Otherwise your children would be unclean, but as it is, they are holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the unbeliever leaves, let it be so. The brother or the sister is not bound in such circumstances; God has called us to live in peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How do you know, wife, whether you will save your husband? Or, how do you know, husband, whether you will save your wife?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, each person should live as a believer in whatever situation the Lord has assigned to them, just as God has called them. This is the rule I lay down in all the churches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Was a man already circumcised when he was called? He should not become uncircumcised. Was a man uncircumcised when he was called? He should not be circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Circumcision is nothing and uncircumcision is nothing. Keeping God’s commands is what counts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each person should remain in the situation they were in when God called them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Were you a slave when you were called? Don’t let it trouble you—although if you can gain your freedom, do so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the one who was a slave when called to faith in the Lord is the Lord’s freed person; similarly, the one who was free when called is Christ’s slave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You were bought at a price; do not become slaves of human beings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers and sisters, each person, as responsible to God, should remain in the situation they were in when God called them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now about virgins: I have no command from the Lord, but I give a judgment as one who by the Lord’s mercy is trustworthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of the present crisis, I think that it is good for a man to remain as he is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are you pledged to a woman? Do not seek to be released. Are you free from such a commitment? Do not look for a wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you do marry, you have not sinned; and if a virgin marries, she has not sinned. But those who marry will face many troubles in this life, and I want to spare you this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What I mean, brothers and sisters, is that the time is short. From now on those who have wives should live as if they do not;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those who mourn, as if they did not; those who are happy, as if they were not; those who buy something, as if it were not theirs to keep;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those who use the things of the world, as if not engrossed in them. For this world in its present form is passing away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I would like you to be free from concern. An unmarried man is concerned about the Lord’s affairs—how he can please the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a married man is concerned about the affairs of this world—how he can please his wife—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his interests are divided. An unmarried woman or virgin is concerned about the Lord’s affairs: Her aim is to be devoted to the Lord in both body and spirit. But a married woman is concerned about the affairs of this world—how she can please her husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am saying this for your own good, not to restrict you, but that you may live in a right way in undivided devotion to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone is worried that he might not be acting honorably toward the virgin he is engaged to, and if his passions are too strong and he feels he ought to marry, he should do as he wants. He is not sinning. They should get married.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the man who has settled the matter in his own mind, who is under no compulsion but has control over his own will, and who has made up his mind not to marry the virgin—this man also does the right thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, he who marries the virgin does right, but he who does not marry her does better.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman is bound to her husband as long as he lives. But if her husband dies, she is free to marry anyone she wishes, but he must belong to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In my judgment, she is happier if she stays as she is—and I think that I too have the Spirit of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now about food sacrificed to idols: We know that “We all possess knowledge.” But knowledge puffs up while love builds up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who think they know something do not yet know as they ought to know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whoever loves God is known by God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, about eating food sacrificed to idols: We know that “An idol is nothing at all in the world” and that “There is no God but one.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even if there are so-called gods, whether in heaven or on earth (as indeed there are many “gods” and many “lords”),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet for us there is but one God, the Father, from whom all things came and for whom we live; and there is but one Lord, Jesus Christ, through whom all things came and through whom we live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But not everyone possesses this knowledge. Some people are still so accustomed to idols that when they eat sacrificial food they think of it as having been sacrificed to a god, and since their conscience is weak, it is defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But food does not bring us near to God; we are no worse if we do not eat, and no better if we do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful, however, that the exercise of your rights does not become a stumbling block to the weak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if someone with a weak conscience sees you, with all your knowledge, eating in an idol’s temple, won’t that person be emboldened to eat what is sacrificed to idols?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So this weak brother or sister, for whom Christ died, is destroyed by your knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you sin against them in this way and wound their weak conscience, you sin against Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, if what I eat causes my brother or sister to fall into sin, I will never eat meat again, so that I will not cause them to fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Am I not free? Am I not an apostle? Have I not seen Jesus our Lord? Are you not the result of my work in the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even though I may not be an apostle to others, surely I am to you! For you are the seal of my apostleship in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is my defense to those who sit in judgment on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t we have the right to food and drink?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t we have the right to take a believing wife along with us, as do the other apostles and the Lord’s brothers and Cephas?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or is it only I and Barnabas who lack the right to not work for a living?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who serves as a soldier at his own expense? Who plants a vineyard and does not eat its grapes? Who tends a flock and does not drink the milk?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do I say this merely on human authority? Doesn’t the Law say the same thing?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is written in the Law of Moses: “Do not muzzle an ox while it is treading out the grain.” Is it about oxen that God is concerned?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely he says this for us, doesn’t he? Yes, this was written for us, because whoever plows and threshes should be able to do so in the hope of sharing in the harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we have sown spiritual seed among you, is it too much if we reap a material harvest from you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If others have this right of support from you, shouldn’t we have it all the more?
But we did not use this right. On the contrary, we put up with anything rather than hinder the gospel of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t you know that those who serve in the temple get their food from the temple, and that those who serve at the altar share in what is offered on the altar?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, the Lord has commanded that those who preach the gospel should receive their living from the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have not used any of these rights. And I am not writing this in the hope that you will do such things for me, for I would rather die than allow anyone to deprive me of this boast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when I preach the gospel, I cannot boast, since I am compelled to preach. Woe to me if I do not preach the gospel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I preach voluntarily, I have a reward; if not voluntarily, I am simply discharging the trust committed to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What then is my reward? Just this: that in preaching the gospel I may offer it free of charge, and so not make full use of my rights as a preacher of the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though I am free and belong to no one, I have made myself a slave to everyone, to win as many as possible.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the Jews I became like a Jew, to win the Jews. To those under the law I became like one under the law (though I myself am not under the law), so as to win those under the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To those not having the law I became like one not having the law (though I am not free from God’s law but am under Christ’s law), so as to win those not having the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the weak I became weak, to win the weak. I have become all things to all people so that by all possible means I might save some.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do all this for the sake of the gospel, that I may share in its blessings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not know that in a race all the runners run, but only one gets the prize? Run in such a way as to get the prize.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who competes in the games goes into strict training. They do it to get a crown that will not last, but we do it to get a crown that will last forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I do not run like someone running aimlessly; I do not fight like a boxer beating the air.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No, I strike a blow to my body and make it my slave so that after I have preached to others, I myself will not be disqualified for the prize.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I do not want you to be ignorant of the fact, brothers and sisters, that our ancestors were all under the cloud and that they all passed through the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were all baptized into Moses in the cloud and in the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all ate the same spiritual food
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and drank the same spiritual drink; for they drank from the spiritual rock that accompanied them, and that rock was Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, God was not pleased with most of them; their bodies were scattered in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these things occurred as examples to keep us from setting our hearts on evil things as they did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be idolaters, as some of them were; as it is written: “The people sat down to eat and drink and got up to indulge in revelry.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We should not commit sexual immorality, as some of them did—and in one day twenty-three thousand of them died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We should not test Christ, as some of them did—and were killed by snakes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And do not grumble, as some of them did—and were killed by the destroying angel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things happened to them as examples and were written down as warnings for us, on whom the culmination of the ages has come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, if you think you are standing firm, be careful that you don’t fall!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No temptation has overtaken you except what is common to mankind. And God is faithful; he will not let you be tempted beyond what you can bear. But when you are tempted, he will also provide a way out so that you can endure it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, my dear friends, flee from idolatry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I speak to sensible people; judge for yourselves what I say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not the cup of thanksgiving for which we give thanks a participation in the blood of Christ? And is not the bread that we break a participation in the body of Christ?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because there is one loaf, we, who are many, are one body, for we all share the one loaf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider the people of Israel: Do not those who eat the sacrifices participate in the altar?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do I mean then that food sacrificed to an idol is anything, or that an idol is anything?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No, but the sacrifices of pagans are offered to demons, not to God, and I do not want you to be participants with demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You cannot drink the cup of the Lord and the cup of demons too; you cannot have a part in both the Lord’s table and the table of demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are we trying to arouse the Lord’s jealousy? Are we stronger than he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have the right to do anything,” you say—but not everything is beneficial. “I have the right to do anything”—but not everything is constructive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one should seek their own good, but the good of others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eat anything sold in the meat market without raising questions of conscience,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for, “The earth is the Lord’s, and everything in it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If an unbeliever invites you to a meal and you want to go, eat whatever is put before you without raising questions of conscience.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if someone says to you, “This has been offered in sacrifice,” then do not eat it, both for the sake of the one who told you and for the sake of conscience.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am referring to the other person’s conscience, not yours. For why is my freedom being judged by another’s conscience?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I take part in the meal with thankfulness, why am I denounced because of something I thank God for?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So whether you eat or drink or whatever you do, do it all for the glory of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not cause anyone to stumble, whether Jews, Greeks or the church of God—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even as I try to please everyone in every way. For I am not seeking my own good but the good of many, so that they may be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Follow my example, as I follow the example of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I praise you for remembering me in everything and for holding to the traditions just as I passed them on to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I want you to realize that the head of every man is Christ, and the head of the woman is man, and the head of Christ is God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every man who prays or prophesies with his head covered dishonors his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But every woman who prays or prophesies with her head uncovered dishonors her head—it is the same as having her head shaved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if a woman does not cover her head, she might as well have her hair cut off; but if it is a disgrace for a woman to have her hair cut off or her head shaved, then she should cover her head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man ought not to cover his head, since he is the image and glory of God; but woman is the glory of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For man did not come from woman, but woman from man;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: neither was man created for woman, but woman for man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is for this reason that a woman ought to have authority over her own head, because of the angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, in the Lord woman is not independent of man, nor is man independent of woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as woman came from man, so also man is born of woman. But everything comes from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judge for yourselves: Is it proper for a woman to pray to God with her head uncovered?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does not the very nature of things teach you that if a man has long hair, it is a disgrace to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but that if a woman has long hair, it is her glory? For long hair is given to her as a covering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone wants to be contentious about this, we have no other practice—nor do the churches of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the following directives I have no praise for you, for your meetings do more harm than good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the first place, I hear that when you come together as a church, there are divisions among you, and to some extent I believe it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No doubt there have to be differences among you to show which of you have God’s approval.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, when you come together, it is not the Lord’s Supper you eat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for when you are eating, some of you go ahead with your own private suppers. As a result, one person remains hungry and another gets drunk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t you have homes to eat and drink in? Or do you despise the church of God by humiliating those who have nothing? What shall I say to you? Shall I praise you? Certainly not in this matter!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I received from the Lord what I also passed on to you: The Lord Jesus, on the night he was betrayed, took bread,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when he had given thanks, he broke it and said, “This is my body, which is for you; do this in remembrance of me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, after supper he took the cup, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in my blood; do this, whenever you drink it, in remembrance of me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whenever you eat this bread and drink this cup, you proclaim the Lord’s death until he comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, whoever eats the bread or drinks the cup of the Lord in an unworthy manner will be guilty of sinning against the body and blood of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone ought to examine themselves before they eat of the bread and drink from the cup.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For those who eat and drink without discerning the body of Christ eat and drink judgment on themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is why many among you are weak and sick, and a number of you have fallen asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we were more discerning with regard to ourselves, we would not come under such judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, when we are judged in this way by the Lord, we are being disciplined so that we will not be finally condemned with the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, my brothers and sisters, when you gather to eat, you should all eat together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Anyone who is hungry should eat something at home, so that when you meet together it may not result in judgment.
And when I come I will give further directions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now about the gifts of the Spirit, brothers and sisters, I do not want you to be uninformed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know that when you were pagans, somehow or other you were influenced and led astray to mute idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I want you to know that no one who is speaking by the Spirit of God says, “Jesus be cursed,” and no one can say, “Jesus is Lord,” except by the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are different kinds of gifts, but the same Spirit distributes them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are different kinds of service, but the same Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are different kinds of working, but in all of them and in everyone it is the same God at work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now to each one the manifestation of the Spirit is given for the common good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To one there is given through the Spirit a message of wisdom, to another a message of knowledge by means of the same Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to another faith by the same Spirit, to another gifts of healing by that one Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to another miraculous powers, to another prophecy, to another distinguishing between spirits, to another speaking in different kinds of tongues, and to still another the interpretation of tongues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these are the work of one and the same Spirit, and he distributes them to each one, just as he determines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as a body, though one, has many parts, but all its many parts form one body, so it is with Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we were all baptized by one Spirit so as to form one body—whether Jews or Gentiles, slave or free—and we were all given the one Spirit to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so the body is not made up of one part but of many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if the foot should say, “Because I am not a hand, I do not belong to the body,” it would not for that reason stop being part of the body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if the ear should say, “Because I am not an eye, I do not belong to the body,” it would not for that reason stop being part of the body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the whole body were an eye, where would the sense of hearing be? If the whole body were an ear, where would the sense of smell be?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in fact God has placed the parts in the body, every one of them, just as he wanted them to be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they were all one part, where would the body be?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As it is, there are many parts, but one body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eye cannot say to the hand, “I don’t need you!” And the head cannot say to the feet, “I don’t need you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the contrary, those parts of the body that seem to be weaker are indispensable,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the parts that we think are less honorable we treat with special honor. And the parts that are unpresentable are treated with special modesty,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while our presentable parts need no special treatment. But God has put the body together, giving greater honor to the parts that lacked it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that there should be no division in the body, but that its parts should have equal concern for each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If one part suffers, every part suffers with it; if one part is honored, every part rejoices with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now you are the body of Christ, and each one of you is a part of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God has placed in the church first of all apostles, second prophets, third teachers, then miracles, then gifts of healing, of helping, of guidance, and of different kinds of tongues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are all apostles? Are all prophets? Are all teachers? Do all work miracles?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do all have gifts of healing? Do all speak in tongues? Do all interpret?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now eagerly desire the greater gifts.
And yet I will show you the most excellent way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I speak in the tongues of men or of angels, but do not have love, I am only a resounding gong or a clanging cymbal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I have the gift of prophecy and can fathom all mysteries and all knowledge, and if I have a faith that can move mountains, but do not have love, I am nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I give all I possess to the poor and give over my body to hardship that I may boast, but do not have love, I gain nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It does not dishonor others, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Love does not delight in evil but rejoices with the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It always protects, always trusts, always hopes, always perseveres.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Love never fails. But where there are prophecies, they will cease; where there are tongues, they will be stilled; where there is knowledge, it will pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we know in part and we prophesy in part,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when completeness comes, what is in part disappears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I was a child, I talked like a child, I thought like a child, I reasoned like a child. When I became a man, I put the ways of childhood behind me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For now we see only a reflection as in a mirror; then we shall see face to face. Now I know in part; then I shall know fully, even as I am fully known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now these three remain: faith, hope and love. But the greatest of these is love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Follow the way of love and eagerly desire gifts of the Spirit, especially prophecy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For anyone who speaks in a tongue does not speak to people but to God. Indeed, no one understands them; they utter mysteries by the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who prophesies speaks to people for their strengthening, encouraging and comfort.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who speaks in a tongue edifies themselves, but the one who prophesies edifies the church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I would like every one of you to speak in tongues, but I would rather have you prophesy. The one who prophesies is greater than the one who speaks in tongues, unless someone interprets, so that the church may be edified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, brothers and sisters, if I come to you and speak in tongues, what good will I be to you, unless I bring you some revelation or knowledge or prophecy or word of instruction?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even in the case of lifeless things that make sounds, such as the pipe or harp, how will anyone know what tune is being played unless there is a distinction in the notes?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, if the trumpet does not sound a clear call, who will get ready for battle?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it is with you. Unless you speak intelligible words with your tongue, how will anyone know what you are saying? You will just be speaking into the air.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Undoubtedly there are all sorts of languages in the world, yet none of them is without meaning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then I do not grasp the meaning of what someone is saying, I am a foreigner to the speaker, and the speaker is a foreigner to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it is with you. Since you are eager for gifts of the Spirit, try to excel in those that build up the church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason the one who speaks in a tongue should pray that they may interpret what they say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if I pray in a tongue, my spirit prays, but my mind is unfruitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So what shall I do? I will pray with my spirit, but I will also pray with my understanding; I will sing with my spirit, but I will also sing with my understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise when you are praising God in the Spirit, how can someone else, who is now put in the position of an inquirer, say “Amen” to your thanksgiving, since they do not know what you are saying?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are giving thanks well enough, but no one else is edified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thank God that I speak in tongues more than all of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in the church I would rather speak five intelligible words to instruct others than ten thousand words in a tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers and sisters, stop thinking like children. In regard to evil be infants, but in your thinking be adults.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the Law it is written:
“With other tongues
    and through the lips of foreigners
I will speak to this people,
    but even then they will not listen to me,
says the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tongues, then, are a sign, not for believers but for unbelievers; prophecy, however, is not for unbelievers but for believers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if the whole church comes together and everyone speaks in tongues, and inquirers or unbelievers come in, will they not say that you are out of your mind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if an unbeliever or an inquirer comes in while everyone is prophesying, they are convicted of sin and are brought under judgment by all,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as the secrets of their hearts are laid bare. So they will fall down and worship God, exclaiming, “God is really among you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What then shall we say, brothers and sisters? When you come together, each of you has a hymn, or a word of instruction, a revelation, a tongue or an interpretation. Everything must be done so that the church may be built up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone speaks in a tongue, two—or at the most three—should speak, one at a time, and someone must interpret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there is no interpreter, the speaker should keep quiet in the church and speak to himself and to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two or three prophets should speak, and the others should weigh carefully what is said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a revelation comes to someone who is sitting down, the first speaker should stop.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you can all prophesy in turn so that everyone may be instructed and encouraged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The spirits of prophets are subject to the control of prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God is not a God of disorder but of peace—as in all the congregations of the Lord’s people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Women should remain silent in the churches. They are not allowed to speak, but must be in submission, as the law says.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they want to inquire about something, they should ask their own husbands at home; for it is disgraceful for a woman to speak in the church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or did the word of God originate with you? Or are you the only people it has reached?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone thinks they are a prophet or otherwise gifted by the Spirit, let them acknowledge that what I am writing to you is the Lord’s command.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if anyone ignores this, they will themselves be ignored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, my brothers and sisters, be eager to prophesy, and do not forbid speaking in tongues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But everything should be done in a fitting and orderly way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, brothers and sisters, I want to remind you of the gospel I preached to you, which you received and on which you have taken your stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By this gospel you are saved, if you hold firmly to the word I preached to you. Otherwise, you have believed in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what I received I passed on to you as of first importance: that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that he was buried, that he was raised on the third day according to the Scriptures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that he appeared to Cephas, and then to the Twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that, he appeared to more than five hundred of the brothers and sisters at the same time, most of whom are still living, though some have fallen asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he appeared to James, then to all the apostles,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and last of all he appeared to me also, as to one abnormally born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am the least of the apostles and do not even deserve to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But by the grace of God I am what I am, and his grace to me was not without effect. No, I worked harder than all of them—yet not I, but the grace of God that was with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whether, then, it is I or they, this is what we preach, and this is what you believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it is preached that Christ has been raised from the dead, how can some of you say that there is no resurrection of the dead?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there is no resurrection of the dead, then not even Christ has been raised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if Christ has not been raised, our preaching is useless and so is your faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: More than that, we are then found to be false witnesses about God, for we have testified about God that he raised Christ from the dead. But he did not raise him if in fact the dead are not raised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the dead are not raised, then Christ has not been raised either.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if Christ has not been raised, your faith is futile; you are still in your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then those also who have fallen asleep in Christ are lost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If only for this life we have hope in Christ, we are of all people most to be pitied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Christ has indeed been raised from the dead, the firstfruits of those who have fallen asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For since death came through a man, the resurrection of the dead comes also through a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as in Adam all die, so in Christ all will be made alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But each in turn: Christ, the firstfruits; then, when he comes, those who belong to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the end will come, when he hands over the kingdom to God the Father after he has destroyed all dominion, authority and power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he must reign until he has put all his enemies under his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The last enemy to be destroyed is death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he “has put everything under his feet.” Now when it says that “everything” has been put under him, it is clear that this does not include God himself, who put everything under Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he has done this, then the Son himself will be made subject to him who put everything under him, so that God may be all in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if there is no resurrection, what will those do who are baptized for the dead? If the dead are not raised at all, why are people baptized for them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as for us, why do we endanger ourselves every hour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I face death every day—yes, just as surely as I boast about you in Christ Jesus our Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I fought wild beasts in Ephesus with no more than human hopes, what have I gained? If the dead are not raised,
“Let us eat and drink,
    for tomorrow we die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be misled: “Bad company corrupts good character.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come back to your senses as you ought, and stop sinning; for there are some who are ignorant of God—I say this to your shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But someone will ask, “How are the dead raised? With what kind of body will they come?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How foolish! What you sow does not come to life unless it dies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you sow, you do not plant the body that will be, but just a seed, perhaps of wheat or of something else.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God gives it a body as he has determined, and to each kind of seed he gives its own body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not all flesh is the same: People have one kind of flesh, animals have another, birds another and fish another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are also heavenly bodies and there are earthly bodies; but the splendor of the heavenly bodies is one kind, and the splendor of the earthly bodies is another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sun has one kind of splendor, the moon another and the stars another; and star differs from star in splendor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So will it be with the resurrection of the dead. The body that is sown is perishable, it is raised imperishable;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it is sown in dishonor, it is raised in glory; it is sown in weakness, it is raised in power;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
it is sown a natural body, it is raised a spiritual body.
If there is a natural body, there is also a spiritual body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it is written: “The first man Adam became a living being”; the last Adam, a life-giving spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The spiritual did not come first, but the natural, and after that the spiritual.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first man was of the dust of the earth; the second man is of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As was the earthly man, so are those who are of the earth; and as is the heavenly man, so also are those who are of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And just as we have borne the image of the earthly man, so shall we bear the image of the heavenly man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I declare to you, brothers and sisters, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God, nor does the perishable inherit the imperishable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen, I tell you a mystery: We will not all sleep, but we will all be changed—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in a flash, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet. For the trumpet will sound, the dead will be raised imperishable, and we will be changed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the perishable must clothe itself with the imperishable, and the mortal with immortality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the perishable has been clothed with the imperishable, and the mortal with immortality, then the saying that is written will come true: “Death has been swallowed up in victory.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Where, O death, is your victory?
    Where, O death, is your sting?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sting of death is sin, and the power of sin is the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But thanks be to God! He gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, my dear brothers and sisters, stand firm. Let nothing move you. Always give yourselves fully to the work of the Lord, because you know that your labor in the Lord is not in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now about the collection for the Lord’s people: Do what I told the Galatian churches to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day of every week, each one of you should set aside a sum of money in keeping with your income, saving it up, so that when I come no collections will have to be made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, when I arrive, I will give letters of introduction to the men you approve and send them with your gift to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it seems advisable for me to go also, they will accompany me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After I go through Macedonia, I will come to you—for I will be going through Macedonia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Perhaps I will stay with you for a while, or even spend the winter, so that you can help me on my journey, wherever I go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I do not want to see you now and make only a passing visit; I hope to spend some time with you, if the Lord permits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will stay on at Ephesus until Pentecost,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because a great door for effective work has opened to me, and there are many who oppose me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Timothy comes, see to it that he has nothing to fear while he is with you, for he is carrying on the work of the Lord, just as I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one, then, should treat him with contempt. Send him on his way in peace so that he may return to me. I am expecting him along with the brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now about our brother Apollos: I strongly urged him to go to you with the brothers. He was quite unwilling to go now, but he will go when he has the opportunity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be on your guard; stand firm in the faith; be courageous; be strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do everything in love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know that the household of Stephanas were the first converts in Achaia, and they have devoted themselves to the service of the Lord’s people. I urge you, brothers and sisters,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to submit to such people and to everyone who joins in the work and labors at it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was glad when Stephanas, Fortunatus and Achaicus arrived, because they have supplied what was lacking from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they refreshed my spirit and yours also. Such men deserve recognition.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The churches in the province of Asia send you greetings. Aquila and Priscilla greet you warmly in the Lord, and so does the church that meets at their house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the brothers and sisters here send you greetings. Greet one another with a holy kiss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, Paul, write this greeting in my own hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone does not love the Lord, let that person be cursed! Come, Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grace of the Lord Jesus be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My love to all of you in Christ Jesus. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
